Calling upon the Possessor of Might who compelled... then their Imam proceeded and said Takbir. A departure that was not objectionable among them... they adhered to deliberateness and dignity. Until they came to Jam' (Muzdalifah) and came to the Mash'ar [Muzdalifah, Saudi Arabia]... then they made the lean, emaciated camels kneel.

In it, they fear the Greater Punishment... until when the light of morning shone. The Morning Departure to Mina: And the night cleared and the day approached... the Imam of the people marched, then they marched. With every man among them were stones... seven small ones, made yellow. Then they proceeded, having dignity upon them... to a Jamrah (pillar) beyond which are pebbles. Then they threw at it and they had 'Kibara' (Takbir)... and they shaved and slaughtered and visited. A day in which there is a flying/scattering for the sacrificial camels... from the length of what the blades sharpen against them. 'Mar'un' (man) is deleted from 'Imri'in' and 'Al-Mar'', so he established it in the place of 'Imri'in', and this exists. 'Sun'un' is from what they shortened. His saying 'Kibara' means 'Takbir', except that he derived it on the dialect of those who say: 'Tirhab' (welcome) and 'Tiksar' (breaking) and others are better than it, Abu Zubayd said. So the scolders rose, and he increased in galloping from them, so a strong lion encountered him. Then Mina, wherein the saddles are thrown... and the people did not cease to be in it. For every man among them were shades... the lawful became permissible for the people there. Days of Tashriq, having reverence... it is nothing but throwing and advancing. And selling, a group of sales of goods like spoils... and giving to the beggar and bestowing. Two days, then the third is departure... until when the decline (of the sun) was known. 'Zilal': A tent or camp. 'It is nothing but throwing and Iqbal' meaning returning to the saddles; it is said to the one turning back 'Aqbil', meaning return towards me. 'Bay'un' is a group of sales of goods as if they are spoils (Anfal). Then the third is departure, meaning then the third day has departure and leaving (Nafir). A caller called, so he stirred my sorrow for a group... and I had thrown the pebbles that are followed. The Jamarat, not in a wasteful manner... seeking the Sunnah by following. Then I lifted the saddle with straps... upon a trustworthy, free, swift she-camel.

Then I came to the House for the Farewell... and I said: 'O Acceptor of the endeavor of the striver. Indeed, my departure from Your House has drawn near... so forgive my sins, O Responder to the caller.' 'Myla' is swift, snatching the lead; from it is 'Aqab Myla' (swift eagle), he said: 'A swift eagle turned away with his protection.' And I said to the camel driver of the Qaraqir (rumbling voice)... Mention Quraysh, the family of the Prophet. The people of generosity and the refusing stronghold... and forbearance if the possessors of generosity are reckless. And single out from them: the children of the Trustee (Wasi)... the sons of the Imam, Al-Murtada Ali. The Lion of Battle and the Pleasing Judgment... that one, despite the enemies, is my Waly (guardian/ally). And to the Banner of Praise and the salvation... and the Basin, the Basin of the Chosen One, the thirst-quenching. The 'Qaraqiri' is from 'Qarqara' (rumbling sound), and 'An-Nadi' is the club/gathering. From Hashim in the House of Pillars... and the Branch from its branches, the tall/straight ones. The masters, the chiefs, the great ones... the first ones, the preceding ancients. The death of the enemy and the wealth of the peaceful... they surpassed the peoples in noble deeds. Imams of the people at the seasons... upon the wish of the satisfied and the spite of the resentful. Nobles, the white ones of the sons of nobles... so who then is called like the tribe of Hashim? The sons of Ali and the sons of Al-Abbas... the good, the noble, the clever. Caliphs of the earth, guides of the people... people of high generosity and people of might. The kernel of the race, the best of races... they possessed the soil of a root and a tough branch. High-nosed (proud) of a firm origin... how many foundations have they built with generosity! They are to the people like the place of the head... there is no measure for them among the people. And the tribe of Taym, the family of As-Siddiq... people of high ranks and ancient soil. No group like them among the people... is found nor met on a road.

The destroyers of enemies for the friend... and the removers of distress, the possessors of the narrow place. And every terrifying, encompassing horror... and every adversary, eloquent in argument. With every sharp edge like the ancient sword... and every lean, noble horse. And mention with what they are worthy of, Adi... the group of an Imam who ceased not to be moist (generous). A victory for the religion, strong and mighty... a presented, pleasing Caliph. A guide to the door of guidance, guided... for that was anciently the companion of the Prophet. Al-Faruq was named noble... skilled in religion and concerned with it. Successful, directed, loyal... sufficient for what he bore, capable. And I am not a hater of Abd Shams... scribes of the revelation of the five prayers. The kernel of a race, oh what a race... facing the fortunate stars, distant from misfortune. They surpassed the peoples, the precedence of yesterday... and the high masters, the armed protectors, the strong. The openers of the door of addressing confusion... and the buyers of praise not cheaply. And in the war, lions possessing prey... fierce in meeting, every day is quarrelsome. And in Banu Zuhrah is glory and generosity... and huge sovereignty with an overflowing, vast ocean. They are the mine of knowledge, lords of graces... and leaders of horses and strikers of the courageous. An authentic branch, extending in the Sanctuary... in its firmly rooted origin and the high branch. In the House of ancient might and support... and feeders of the people in the year of crisis. And the attainers of the highest of great ambitions... they are the maternal uncles of the Righteous, the Truthful in the oath. And mention and do not forget Banu Makhzum... lords of ancient, inherited glory. And people of lofty, great might... the kernel of a flourishing, pure branch. Maternal uncles of a truthful, merciful splashing (rain/generosity)... inherited in the Hijr and the Hatim. So Arafat, then to At-Taneem [At-Taneem, Mecca]... they did not settle in the decayed dwelling.

From the most deep-rooted, noble lineage... how many among them are generous and forbearing. And the protection of the tribe and the fortress of the neighbor... and mention with good mention Abd al-Dar. The branch of the Sarah (chiefs), the masters, the chosen ones... in the high peak of Nizar. Custodians of the House of Allah, possessor of curtains... and his neighbor in righteousness is the best neighbor. They have a lineage, what a lineage... rain/blessing for them from a righteous group. The white camels did not carry on the saddles... the likes of them a day for a striking flint. 'As-Sadan' and 'As-Sadanah' are the doorkeepers/custodians, and they are the preventers, and 'Al-Haddad' is the doorkeeper; 'haddahu' means he prevented him. That is Quraysh of might in its open valleys... in its high kingdom and in its righteousness. The white camels did not carry on their sides... the likes of Quraysh of might in its relief. Needs were not sought for their success... in the years of drought with their urgency. From the likes of them for pardon in their forgiveness... and horses were not turned back from their defiance. Bristling with heroes in their weaponry... with the likes of them, resistance is made against their spears. 'Sha'ik' is from 'Shawka' (thorn/power) and it is inverted so it is said 'Shaki as-Silah' (fully armed), and one resists (ya'si) with swords and does not use a staff (ya'su). She bade farewell to whom she bade farewell in the middle of the Hijr... from them without a sin nor out of abandonment. But my companionship alerted me to the departure... and longing and some remembrance stirred me. To a white, noble, young she-camel... split from the sun and the light of the full moon. So I said to the camel driver who excels with the mounts: ... sing to her in the croaks of the driving. Among she-camels like the dull-colored sandgrouse... then the salvation/speed, I have fulfilled some of the excuse. So he said to me a saying out of pity... when he saw the intensity of my longing. From the tear of an eye, flowing and glistening... 'Are you announcing the separation to me?'

So I said: 'Indeed, my departure has drawn near... I advise you with the covenant and the pact. And gentleness and the pure of morals... and be in goodness, may the Protector protect you.' And under my saddle is one of remaining flesh... a Mahri camel, protruding in veins. I ascend with her Al-Abtah and As-Safah... then the pass from Nakhlah when it widened. She rises from its gates (Bawbat) joyfully... to the water of Qarn [As-Sayl Al-Kabir], hurrying the departure. And she cast away her trivets (stones), a casting... until when she came to the open land. She aimed for Canopus (Suhayl) in the darkness when it appeared... and a drink that was overthrown by places of overthrow. Folding Jaldan and wiping it... until she saw the morning at Awqah. 'Idtarahat': She fabricated/acted from 'Ad-Darh', which is the kicking of stones by the hoof of the horse's leg. Arriving with the first of the arrivals... with a rider of high ambition, driving. Kohl-rimmed with longing and sleeplessness... then she set out early before the early riser. So she left Safn on a deviation... to a dragging place, trotting, guided by the guide. Then upon Nahiyah of the highland (Najd)... folding to the rocky path of... As if she is, from the fear of the driver's rebuke... a wild donkey followed by the hunter. Then she set out early while the star did not descend... aiming in the Yemeni horizon for the star. From Kurkur covering the fertile Kur'ah... and in Kara strutting in a dark night. She ascends from the Harrah rough, rugged ground... and at times she ascends plains, vast plains. Until when the wing of darkness went west... I brought her to the heels of a scabby night. Thirsty, hot, wanting the drinking place... then she set out from it early, a streamlined departure. 'Shawdhaba' means stripped/streamlined; 'Al-Akhshab' is the rough ground mixed with ruggedness and roughness. Strutting, she walks joyfully in her briskness... like the virgin songstress in her youth.

Ascending the plains of the earth with its hardships... to Al-Qariha at the top of Da'b. To Riyad al-Khayl in her slipping away... like the sandgrouse of the fifth day (of thirst) in its pouring down. Until she came at the time of her return... opposite the palms on her fatigue. Hurrying (Nasilah) in the palms not from its gate... passing, so she did not twist towards its cuttings. Meaning its fodder. Except for nourishment on haste... or for an ambition in a swelling law/water. That is the light of the sun possessing yellowness... then she flew, what a flight. A swift she-camel aiming for Dhu Samar... with a rider of traveling ambition. Feeling from the pain of remembrance... longing on the heart like the sting of fire. To a young woman, radiant, perfumed... wide-eyed like the full moon traveling at night. That remained her state and my state... covering the darkness of the night and the terrors. Until she came to Turja on loads... and Bisha [Bisha, Saudi Arabia] of the palms without negligence. Startled like the ostrich following... the reddish-white, the long chain-like. So she reached a water trough in the morning, empty... and the light of the high day had appeared. With activity, not lazy... then she lined up like the sandgrouse of the dune. From a rugged dwelling, little of stopping... she traverses the desert, what a traversing. With a rider who did not know what he hides... in the heart of longing, the construction of death. To a white camel with full hair... and a clear, dark-lipped one, cool in the kiss. And a slim-waisted one, slender, with raised buttocks... O she-camel, what does this description avail you? 'Haydi' (Go), come let us go with the seriousness of the trot. 'Istataffat': She rose from the 'taff' (surface) of the bird above the earth; 'Sha'z' and 'Sha'iz' mean one difficult place with twisting, and its origin is 'Sha'iz' like 'Ha'ir' and 'Har'. 'Mashad' means it is a root/origin.

Then she set out early, resolving to go... to watercourses at the destination of Dab. To Ar-Rabadat, not doubtful... to Sinan al-Wa'th, possessor of spots. To Banat Harb, so traverse... to a water source in the valley of valleys. Then return from it to Hirjab [Wadi Hirjab]... to the two sons of Dad, so the parties rumbled. And after pulling, she returned to the gathering place... Yabambam, praised in return. Until when I brought her to Yabambam... and the night had cast a dark chest. She did not desire at the watering to hesitate... except to drink or gobble. Then I scolded the strong, robust she-camel... to folds comprising a dark wing. So she burned without night whenever... I said she flagged, she returned with a swift trot. So she reached in the morning, and the night had passed... Kutnah, as it was a marked place for water. I said, and the stars, my desire, had set... O kindler of... Then she came on a holiday, a day of sleep... so wake up from the intoxication of a day that belongs. 'I am a son of Shahran [Shahran Tribe], noble of root... we ask who was the Imam of the season.' I said to him with a saying not mumbled: ... 'The Sheikh of Banu Abbas, so know and understand.' And a hastening she-camel split away from him, throwing herself... traversing the darkness of the dark night. So she fell after the length of fatigue... into the fertile water source of the two wells. Then she warmed herself like the father of two chicks... rushing from fear of the caller of separation. Rising with the eye and the two hands... twisting with a tail on the two thighs. As the hand of the smith twisted the rope... so she encountered a biting place, Arar'in. Then upon Ash-Shafshaf of the two milestones... then her covering is Sarum al-Ain. He means the interior of Thajjah and the bottom of its stream with Dhuwat Ush, and it is as if added to 'Da'i al-Bayn' (Caller of Separation), a man or a mountain, as it was said of a mountain above Najran [Najran, Saudi Arabia] 'Qadi' meaning 'Qadi Dayn' (Judge of Debt).

The Rajaz poet said: 'When he saw the Judge of Debt appearing... with a group, he stormed Az-Zaydan.' A place. 'Mahfudah' (rushing) from fear of the caller of separation, and there is no meaning for this, as the she-camel is not frightened by the caller of separation, but it is among what was changed by Ar-Rada'i and remained with its change, and Al-Jawf is in the place where she fell. Until when I brought her to Sarum... where you see the wells and the vines. She made a hollow sound, leaping, a broken saddle... as you saw the falsified dirham. It was nothing but drinking and gobbling... until she dragged a drawing camel driver. She bore the burden of Uraynib, the burdensome... and from the places of hardship, the rugged grounds. That remained her habit, the core... enduring the difficulties, a bulky nose. How many did she fold in the darkness of the intense nights... trotting to At-Talhah from Nasanis. A correction of a rigid mountain... and a rugged path, cooing in a dark darkness. So she became, before the hope of the friendly one... at Al-Ard from the morning of the fifth day. With a rider, feeling the clothes... awake of head, not drowsy. Traversing the deserts without a companion. Then she ascended the belly of Sarum trotting... heading to Sa'dah [Saada, Yemen], a direct march. With a rider who cast away slumber and sleep... guarding a covenant for Hind despite the distance. When Isa saw the serious march... he threw by it Wand Dar and As-Sada. The plain she folds and she ascends the highland... until she came to Sa'dah complaining of the fatigue. Hurrying, preceding the delegations in it... it was nothing but mouthfuls and arriving. In a dwelling that was suitable for her... easy, with fodder and a clear trough. If she missed my concern to precede the predecessor... then she strove in a dark darkness. Aiming from Qadan the top of Al-Khaniq... and springs for the diamonds and the crane-like camels. For a Tamu' (camel) stepping on thorns... So she reached Khaywan [Khaywan, Yemen] of the gardens in the morning. And the dawn when it appeared in the east... with a rider concealing the affair of the lover.

He did not calculate it was as Al-Farazdaq said: 'A remnant of a group who were noble.' Until she threw herself at the obstacle of Al-Faqa'... from the returning ones like the arrow of shooting. Aiming for Jurfah of the branch... then wonderfully with a descent, putting down. Lowering to Raydah [Raydah, Yemen] after the lifting... until she came to it at the passing of the gathering. By the grace of Allah, the Majestic in Made... and His bestowal, the huge, and the goodness of defense. Then she leaned after the sleep of the seventh... lean like the crescent moon shedding (its old shape). To the path of Al-Hayfah of the traverse... she yearns with longing, the yearning of the one pulled away. To a sandy place of rugged ground and wading places... so she reached at the rising morning. Sana'a [Sana'a, Yemen] from the morning of the seventh day... by the grace of Allah, the Majestic, the Maker. And His bestowal and His vast favor... the Beneficent, the Giver, the Mighty, the Preventer. Then she leaned crossing the width of the field... with a rider, a crown of little weight. Her concern is cared for with a blistering march... so I heated her before the return of the shade. She adds Bawsan, traversing the ostrich-like land... and Juban from it with a gentle trot. I said to her when she settled on the plain... of Juban: 'O my she-camel, my family, my family.' I cast my saddle at the west of Rada' [Rada'a, Yemen]... by the favor of my Lord, Possessor of Heights and Bounty. Then be safe, O she-camel, as long as you remain... and graze my namesake to the trellis wherever you wish. And from the evil of coercion what you disliked... and the bank, if you found it easy, you grazed. And the quenched watering place if you thirsted... to whatever water in villages you were watered. O soul, is there thanks for what you were given... from the making of a Lord, Originator, Causer of death.

Blessed is the Most Merciful as a Sustainer... Glory be to Him as an Originator, a Causer of death. So praise be to Allah for His beneficence... and His known favor and gratitude. The Possessor of Kindness journeyed us in His lands... in His pardonable provision and in His safety. Until we came to the House in its place... then we finished our affair regarding its affair. From its Tawaf and the wiping of its corners... then Allah guided us in His guarantee. Each to the beloved of his homelands... with what he hopes of His forgiveness. The Urjuzah (poem) is completed, and with its completion, the Book of the Peninsula of the Arabs is completed. And praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, and His blessings be upon Muhammad, the Seal of the Prophets, and his pure Family and Companions, and peace.
